channel.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
channel.description:
[b] SMART Hard Disk Error
The SMART hard disk check has detected an imminent failure. To ensure not data loss, please backup the content immediately and run the Hard Disk Test in System Diagnostics.
Hard Disk 1 (301)
F2 System Diagnostics
ENTER - Continue Startup
For more information, please visit:[color=blue] www.hp.com\go\techcenter\startup [/color][/b] [b]======================================================================================= There is a Hard Disk issue on my notebook that is preventing windows from starting up. I went to the provided website but it didn't exactly help in any specific way. I have been getting continuously warned to backup my computer since it was saying that it was possibly going to happen. But being an idiot, I didn't feel like taking the time to go through the process of backing it up. Could someone give and possible solutions?[/b]

item.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
item.dc:creator: @Sulterize Sulterize
item.description:
@Sulterize wrote:

So I just seen some Cyber Link options and found an option to load to factory settings, which I’m doing now. There was also a way to back up my information through it but it was 9.50GB and I did not have a DVD-R or DVD+R CD to load it all onto as it specified. It’s been installing required software for the past 12 hours, I will let you all know if it works. But, thank you for your consideration and effort to help me through the issue.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Seagate.com

SeaTools | Seagate

SeaTools – Schnelldiagnose-Tool zur Überprüfung des Zustands Ihrer Festplatte

Download Seatools for dos, burn it onto a floppy or make a usb stick bootable with it. Try do a full diagnosis with it and basically force it do it recovery.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You could try executing a low-level format. If you need to back something up first, you could find an HDD caddy and try accessing the files on a machine with a good hard disk through the caddy.

item.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
item.dc:creator: @Sulterize Sulterize
item.description:
@Sulterize wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:2, topic:443135”]Try doing what it says. Back the data up and see if it stops.[/quote]That’s the problem, I can’t back it up. Windows will not fully start up. It says I could recover from a backup point but I never saved one so I can’t. It gives me the option to run different diagnostic tests, but they all fail.

Read full topic

item.title: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
item.dc:creator: @Sulterize Sulterize
item.description:
@Sulterize wrote:

[b] SMART Hard Disk Error

The SMART hard disk check has detected an imminent failure. To ensure not data loss, please
backup the content immediately and run the Hard Disk Test in System Diagnostics.

Hard Disk 1 (301)

F2 System Diagnostics

ENTER - Continue Startup

For more information, please visit:[color=blue] www.hp.com\go\techcenter\startup
[/color][/b]
=======================================================================================
There is a Hard Disk issue on my notebook that is preventing windows from starting up. I went to the provided website but it didn’t exactly help in any specific way. I have been getting continuously warned to backup my computer since it was saying that it was possibly going to happen. But being an idiot, I didn’t feel like taking the time to go through the process of backing it up. Could someone give and possible solutions?

Read full topic
item.source: HP Compaq Presario CQ56 Hard Disk issues
